channel.title: How To Make 3D Text With Metasequoia
channel.description:
Ok, first things first. You will need to register your version of Metasequoia (It is quite handy :P ).
[quote="SilentCJ, post:2, topic:275142"]OK, first of all, we want to register your version of metasequoia, solely for the reason that you can. Open up metasequoia, and on the top menu, right up the top, click Help, then in the drop down menu, there is a button that says "Registration", click this. Should bring up a menu where a serial and password needs to be submitted.
Use [b]one[/b] of these:
[code] serial 372A39-2132 password j1eT-W2NR-Br04
serial 4C6A3w-699F password gs31-cCDb-3TdO
serial 7436Bj-50E3 password jxhg-GUDx-wruX
serial 71A54J-2954 password qRv2-M93U-sfDY
serial 1498Ds-7837 password uWXt-YlwE-Naeh [/code]
Click Ok, or w/e, and it should give you a small message. Restart metasequoia, and under Object toolbar, there should be some tools, e.g, delete lines, there are several other tools in different menu's also but i'm not gonna go on about them.
[b]Important: Go to file, and untick basic mode.[/b] A bunch of new tools should appear on the left side menu.[/quote]Thanks CJ , you rock ;)
Ok, now let's start!
Open Up Metasequoia, if you don't have the program yet please download it from the link below Http://www.Metaseq.Net In the program you will find a Menu, with common things like : File, Edit, Attribute Etc. Find 'Object' and click on it. In the menu drop 'Object' you will see 'Create' if you cannot find it, please start over. Go to 'Create' and you will see 'Landscape' and 'Create Text'. Click on 'Create Text' and wait untill a form pops-up. In the form you will see '?????' Translated = Font. Pick the font of your likings or leave it to Arial. You will also see '???' Translated = Text. Enter the text of your likings here. The last thing that you will see is '????????' Translated = Font Size. Put the font size of your likings in or leave it to 5. Click on 'Ok'. There you have it, your text the only thing is that it is not 3D yet. To do this do the following: In the Menu click on 'Edit' and then click on 'Select All'. Now, in the Menu click on 'Selected' and then click on 'Extrude Faces'. The normal size is 10 , you can change that or leave it to 10. Click on 'Ok'. Now your text is 2D, well done. In the Menu click on 'Edit' and 'Select All' once again. Once again, in the Menu click on 'Selected' and then 'Round'. A new form will pop-up , with a number 10 into it. You can move the form to show the text as it becomes 3D. Change the 10 untill the text looks nice and smoothly 3D.
You're done!
[quote="cocoa"]Also, people, you don't have to do the round. Try flatten, also gives cool text effects.[/quote]
Copyrighted (C) AssassinsCreedFan

item.title: How To Make 3D Text With Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:32, topic:284561”]Also, people, you don’t have to do the round. Try flatten, also gives cool text effects see above[/quote]Gives a nice effect indeed.
But I do recommend round
But yeah different opinions, thanks for the share

Read full topic

item.title: How To Make 3D Text With Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Here, just quote all this.

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:275142”]OK, first of all, we want to register your version of metasequoia, solely for the reason that you can.
Open up metasequoia, and on the top menu, right up the top, click Help, then in the drop down menu, there is a button that says “Registration”, click this.
Should bring up a menu where a serial and password needs to be submitted.

Use one of these:

serial 372A39-2132
password j1eT-W2NR-Br04

serial 4C6A3w-699F
password gs31-cCDb-3TdO

serial 7436Bj-50E3
password jxhg-GUDx-wruX

serial 71A54J-2954
password qRv2-M93U-sfDY

serial 1498Ds-7837
password uWXt-YlwE-Naeh

Click Ok, or w/e, and it should give you a small message.
Restart metasequoia, and under Object toolbar, there should be some tools, e.g, delete lines, there are several other tools in different menu’s also but i’m not gonna go on about them.

Important: Go to file, and untick basic mode.
A bunch of new tools should appear on the left side menu.[/quote]
